definition[0]: a tool with a heavy metal part on a long handle, used for hitting nails into wood
definition[1]: a tool like this with a wooden head used to make something flat, make a noise etc
definition[2]: the part of a gun that hits the explosive charge that fires a bullet
definition[3]: a heavy metal ball on a wire with a handle at the end, which you throw as far as possible as a sport
definition[4]: a wooden part of a piano that hits the strings inside to make a musical sound
definition[5]: to hit something with a hammer in order to force it into a particular position or shape
example[1]: the sound of hammering and sawing
example[2]: Hammer the nails into the back of the frame.
example[3]: All afternoon, Martin had been hammering away in the conservatory.
definition[6]: to hit something many times, especially making a loud noise
example[4]: The rain was hammering against the window.
definition[7]: to hurt someone or something by causing them a lot of problems
example[6]: British industry was being hammered by the recession.
definition[8]: to hit or kick something very hard
example[7]: Robinson hammered the ball into the goal.
definition[9]: to strongly criticize or attack someone for something they have said or done
example[8]: The president has been hammered for his lack of leadership.
definition[10]: if your heart hammers, you feel it beating strongly and quickly
example[9]: She stood outside the door, her heart hammering.
definition[11]: to defeat someone completely at a sport
definition[12]: to be sold at an AUCTION
example[11]: The paintings come under the hammer at Sotheby’s in November.
definition[13]: to sell a large amount of stocks, shares etc at one time, causing prices to fall
